reviews.text: If you like a hotel with character and centrally located, Jade Garden is the place. You can walk to the Forbidden City, and the surrounding neighborhood is fun and interesting. While it is older, it has been maintained well, offers a great buffet breakfast, and the concierge, Yang, is outstanding. We highly recommend him to arrange your travel to the Great Wall.
reviews.title: Very nice and great location

reviews.text: Location, Location, Location! Short walk to Forbidden City,Tiananmen Square and the night market. We loved our stay it was clean and a very large room (suite). We had two adults and one child and were very comfortable. I would have given this hotal 5 stars BUT.......
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION! but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We exchanged money at the front desk and we were given COUNTERFEIT YUAN BACK FOR OUR US DOLLARS. We exchanged cash three times and it only happened one time. When in china, ALWAYS use a bank. The only positive was that the fake money is one of the best souvenirs we brought home :)
reviews.title: Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next to all, this budget hotel is very nice. Staff is kind and helpfull. It is near to Forbidden City and Wangfuging Street where there is a mall with lots of places to eat and shop. Subway station is not so near but taxis are inexpensive.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.text: When we checked in our tour guide asked if we could have a king bed if available instead of the 2 doubles. They said for $150 more they could accommodate for the three nights we were staying. We paid the extra and when we got to our room it was not a king but a double bed at best! Then when we went into the bathroom there was mold around the tub and in the corners. See attached photos. Breakfast was good with a good selection.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Jade Garden Hotel is designed with a lot of authentic Chinese character. The neatest part about the hotel is the wall of the hotel's history. Great location as well - close to the forbidden city, the famous night food market and the major modern shopping area. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms cleans. The restaurant had a skylight which was a wonderful place to eat and get your day started. Breakfast food had flavor, variety and was tasty. The spa is cheap (if paying by USD or EUROs or Pounds), their is also another spa a few doors down which is just as cheap but elegant and clean and is open until midnight. Skip the hotel bar and go explore Beijing with the locales. Overall great value for the hotel and service. Staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: Cute boutique hotel and great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in Sept. The room was quiet, clean, and comfortable. There is internet access available via the TV. The staff spoke English and were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square, and the Forbidden City. It is close to Wanfujing Street where there are many shops and restaurants. We particularly liked the choice of restaurants in The Oriental Plaza Mall. It takes around 15 minutes to walk to the nearest subway station which connects to all the tourist attractions in Beijing.
reviews.title: Good location in Beijing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff are attentive and communicate well enough in English albeit strict on my behavior that is good to upkeep the quality of the hotel. The room is well-equipped spoiled with so many TV channels and cute night light and service was prompt when I asked for a tea-spoon. The locality is superb, within walking distance to the Forbidden City Tiananmen, National Museum and Wan Fu Jin street. The streets besides the hotel are not too busy and allows easy walk and stroll. Many of which are well landscaped and feel like in a garden or a park. It easy to locate eateries around for all the Beijing foods and a Subway outlet just in front if you long for toast and bread. I can recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Strategic locality in Beijing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We kicked off our China trip in Bejing, where we stayed at the Jade Garden for three nights.
reviews.title: Clean,

reviews.text: The hotel is very well located - near to the Forbidden City, right next to Wan Fu Jin Street where a hub of shops and restaurants can be found. We spent one evening wondering along the food market, munching our way through kebab sticks, dumplings and sampling numerous deep fried treats. This hotel seems to be well known by taxi drivers, making it easy to find your way back.
reviews.title: Good location, great breakfast

reviews.text: Good, clean hotel. Wired internet in room. Helpful concierge with reasonalble english. ~400 meters from the Forbidden City and ~200 meters from the walking/shopping street. Bus #2 stops ~50meters from hotel, main bus lines and subway are ~500 meters away.
reviews.title: Easy access to Forbidden City, free wired-internet...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A decent hotel in a good part of town. Accomodation wasn't the best for four star but met the general standard. Had a massage which was pretty average. We had a good supper at the hotel but the breakfast was average. It's good for business and very close to tianamen square and the forbidden city.
reviews.title: Location is good for exploring Beijing about 750 m from metro

reviews.text: We spent several nights here with friends as part of an organised 6 day itinery and prelude to a cruise around South East Asia. Our first stop was Bejing and this was interspersed with a visit to Xian on the overnight train (to see the Terracotta Army which was fantastic!) The staff were helpful enough considering the language barrier but the best thing was by far the breakfast! This was great with fantastic Eurasian mix enabling everyone to try a little but still have the usual stuff if you weren't in the mood.
reviews.title: Great location to explore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean, tidy and big enough for a short stay. There was also a cosy Bar in the hotel although I believe it was usual tourist prices!
reviews.title: it's all about the location

reviews.text: The hotel was minutes away from the well known Street Market offering fried scorpions and Dog Pot!? We didn't partake but it was definitely the best market I've ever been to! The hotel was also perfectly based for Tiannamen square, forbidden city, Summer Palace, Great Wall and many more.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: Very impressed with this hotel !
reviews.title: Lovely central hotel ! Good value !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights, then went to Xian and other places in China - No problem in leaving luggage in hotel to pick up when we got back to Beijing for 1 more night .
reviews.title: Great Location
Location awesome, but hotel disappointing
reviews.text: Beds very comfy, superior rooms on 4th floor spacious - towels big and fluffy - kettle, tea/coffee and 2 free bottle of water every day !
Very good value and service in fab location ! Request of extra pillows very prompt, plus early check in when we arrived !
reviews.title: A great 4 star hotel - consider it for Beijing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also fab position - turn right from hotel main entrance, and in no time you have good restaurants and night street market ( scorpions, spiders, etc, snacks in the stick ) and all other goodies :)
reviews.title: Terrible experience
